in section 18553 and which has a flush toilet and a bath or shower inspection officer means the city inspector or authorized agent licensee means any person licensed to operate and maintain a mobilemanufactured home park under this chapter manufactured home means a structure transportable in one or more sections which in the traveling mode is eight body feet or more in width or 40 body feet or more in length or when erected on site covers 320 or more square feet and which is built on a permanent chassis and designed to be used as a dwelling with or without a permanent foundation when connected to the required utilities and includes the plumbing heating air conditioning and electrical systems contained thereon the term manufactured home does not include any structure or vehicle which is owned by a religious corporation or society and is used exclusively for religious purposes the term mobile home means a manufactured home transportable in one section the term sectional home means a manufactured home transportable in two or more sections these terms shall not include any travel trailerrecreational vehicle or any selfpropelled vehicle used as living quarters whether referred to as a motor home or by any other name trailers or semitrailers used for the transportation of goods or property other than the personal belongings of the owner of the vehicle shall not be included in this definition mobile home means a singlefamily dwelling designed for transportation on streets and highways on its own wheels or on flatbed or other trailers both highway and rail and arriving at the site where it is to be occupied as a dwelling complete and ready for occupancy except for minor and incidental unpacking and assembly operations location on jacks or permanent foundation connection to utilities and similar operations the term mobile home shall not include modular homes or prefabricated homes that meet all city codes unless otherwise indicated in the text of this chapter the term mobile home refers to an independent mobilemanufactured home as defined in this section see also the definition of manufactured home mobilemanufactured home park means any plot of ground upon which two or more mobilemanufactured homes occupied for dwelling or sleeping purposes are located regardless of whether or not a charge is made for such accommodations mobilemanufactured home space means a plot of ground within a mobilemanufactured home park designed for the accommodation of one mobilemanufactured home and not located on a mobilemanufactured home sales lot mobilemanufactured home subdivision means a subdivision designed and intended for residential use where residence is in mobilemanufactured homes exclusively and mobilemanufactured home lots are sold for occupancy nonresidential mobile trailer means any vehicle having the basic characteristics of either a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle but which is used for purposes other than residential and is not being offered for sale as indicated by a clearly displayed sign on or near the trailer park means a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park public water system or public sewer system means any such system built and owned by or dedicated to and accepted by the city  all other such systems are private recreational vehicle means a class d motor vehicle provided such vehicle is a selfpropelled or towed vehicle that is equipped to serve as temporary living quarters for recreational camping or travel purposes and is used solely as a family or personal conveyance rural means any area that is zoned agriculturally service building means a building housing toilet and bathing facilities for men or women and may also include buildings containing laundry facilities and other facilities as required by this chapter or desired by the park operator subdivision means a mobilemanufactured home subdivision unless otherwise indicated travel trailerrecreational vehicle means a vehicle or portable structure built on a chassis designed as a temporary or permanent dwelling for travel recreational and vacation use not included in the definition of an independent mobilemanufactured home travel trailerrecreational vehicle park means any plot of ground upon which two or more travel trailersrecreational vehicles occupied for dwelling or sleeping purposes are located regardless of whether or not a charge is made for such accommodations travel trailerrecreational vehicle space means a plot of ground within a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park designed for accommodation of one travel trailerrecreational vehicle urban means any area not zoned agriculturally    penalty any person violating this chapter shall be fined in an amount as described in the city fee schedule plus costs for each offense each day shall constitute a separate violation    freestanding mobilemanufactured home a location in urban area no freestanding mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle shall be permitted in the urban area unless it is being offered for sale or parked for storage except for mobilemanufactured homes or travel trailersrecreational vehicles within regular commercial mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle sales lots each such freestanding mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle offered for sale must be clearly marked as such shall not be occupied for either living or sleeping purposes and must be removed from the premises if not sold within 120 days freestanding mobilemanufactured homes or travel trailersrecreational vehicles located within regular commercial mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle sales lots need be neither individually marked for sale nor removed within 120 days if not sold a property owner shall not store or permit to be stored more than one mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle on a residential lot such mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle may be stored on a hard surface but shall not be stored in any required front yard in an unscreened side yard or public utility easement nor shall such mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle project beyond the front of any building b location in rural area freestanding mobilemanufactured homes shall be permitted in the rural area only in agricultural zoning districts permits for such freestanding mobilemanufactured homes shall be issued by the inspection officer but only when the applicant agrees in writing to remove such mobilemanufactured home within 120 days after either the mobilemanufactured home site is rezoned to a district other than agricultural or is abutted within 660 feet by a district other than agricultural such freestanding mobilemanufactured homes must comply with all normal city regulations except the specific qualifications to the housing code outlined for mobilemanufactured homes in article vi of this chapter no mobilemanufactured home parks shall be permitted in the areas within the city limits lying west of state highway no 102 notwithstanding the fact that such areas may be in agricultural zoning districts c location on lake lots the following shall apply to mobilemanufactured homes located on lake lots 1 all mobilemanufactured homes placed on lake lease lots must be skirted and tied down or anchored 2 the lessee must submit an approved septic system certificate of approval before a permit will be issued to place the mobilemanufactured home on a lake lease lot 3 the mobilemanufactured home lake lease lot owner will be required to submit to the city code enforcement department a certified inspection of its septic system not less than every five years and upon all lake lease lot transfers 4 any mobilemanufactured home placed on a lake lease lot must have all required permits and have all inspections with a certificate of occupancy prior to occupying the mobilemanufactured home 5 all septic systems must be installed and maintained in accordance with the state department of environmental quality bulletin no 600 and the city codes 5     1132003 secs 1841830  reserved article ii  notices hearings and orders notice of violations whenever the inspection officer determines that a violation of pertinent sections under this chapter exists he shall notify the licensee or permittee of such alleged violation such notice shall 1 be in writing  2 include a statement of the reasons for its issuance  3 contain an outline of remedial action which if taken will effect compliance with this chapter and other pertinent regulations  4 allow a reasonable time not to exceed 90 days for the performance of any act it requires  and 5 be served upon the owner or his agent as the case may require however such notice or order shall be deemed as properly served upon the owner or agent when a copy thereof has been sent by certified mail to his last known address    hearing before board of housing appeals any person affected by any notice issued under this chapter or other regulation may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the board of housing appeals provided that such person shall file with the inspection officer a written request for such hearing setting forth briefly the grounds for such request within ten days after the day the notice was served the filing of such request shall stay notice of suspension of permits and licenses except for orders issued under section 1835 the hearing shall be held at the next board of housing appeals meeting for which the agenda has not been completed or at a later meeting if so requested by the petitioner if the inspection officer determines sufficient cause for such delay exists    findings of board of housing appeals  issuance of order after hearing held pursuant to section 1832 the inspection officer shall compile the findings of the board of housing appeals as to compliance with this chapter and regulations and shall issue an order in writing sustaining modifying or withdrawing the prior notice which shall be served as provided in section 1831 upon failure to comply with such order the permit of the mobilemanufactured home park or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be revoked    appeals to city commission appeals from decisions of the board of housing appeals made pursuant to this chapter shall be to the city commission any person aggrieved by the decision of the city commission may seek relief in the district court    emergency procedure whenever the inspection officer finds that an emergency exists which requires immediate action to protect the public health he may without notice or hearing issue an order reciting the existence of such an emergency and requiring that such action be taken as he may deem necessary to meet the emergency including the suspension of the permit notwithstanding any other section of this chapter such order shall be effective immediately any person to whom such an order is directed shall comply therewith immediately but upon petition to the city commission shall be afforded a hearing at the next regular meeting as an item of new business even if the agenda has been completed shall be applicable to such hearing and the order issued thereafter    secs 18361860  reserved article iii  special permits application  hearing  action by commission a any person who has a special or hardship case and who desires to park a mobilemanufactured home upon property located within the corporate limits of the city may make written application to the planning commission for a hearing to determine the facts relating to his case upon filing such application the applicant shall pay a fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule to cover the cost of processing the application the planning commission is authorized to hear such application after public notice has been given by publishing notice of the hearing in a newspaper of general circulation which is printed within the city not less than 15 days prior to the hearing the planning commission shall consider such application and review such matters as the nature of the applicants special or hardship case and shall consider the proposed location of such mobilemanufactured home with regard to the type of buildings or dwellings within the general area of such proposed location and the relationship of such mobilemanufactured homes to the neighborhood the planning commission may require written consent of adjacent property owners when in its judgment it is deemed necessary or advisable b upon hearing the planning commission shall make its recommendation to approve or disapprove such application which recommendation shall be forwarded to the city commission for its consideration the city commission shall review the application the recommendations of the planning commission and any other evidence it deems necessary or advisable the city commission may accept or reject the recommendation of the planning commission    issuance if the application made under this article is approved by the city commission the city commission shall authorize the issuance of a special permit by the city clerk for a mobilemanufactured home to be parked upon the property subject to such application    transfer  expiration  use of home a special permit issued under this article shall be personal and shall not be transferable the special permit shall expire upon the termination of the special or hardship situation set forth in the application the mobilemanufactured home under such special permit shall be used and occupied by the persons so authorized and shall not be transferred rented or leased for use by any other person at such approved location however any mobilemanufactured home which has been located within the corporate limits under a special or hardship permit for a period of seven years or longer may remain at such location as a nonconforming use which use shall be controlled by the provisions of the city zoning code relating to nonconformities as amended from time to time and after the period of seven years it will no longer be necessary to make annual reports to the city as provided in section 1864    annual report a person issued a permit under this article shall make an annual report to the city clerk showing that the hardship or special situation still exists however if such mobilemanufactured home is allowed by the city to remain at such location for a period of seven years or longer no annual report is necessary after the seventh year    inspection fee the holder of the special permit issued under this article shall pay a fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule annually to cover the costs of inspection of the mobilemanufactured home    secs 18661890  reserved article iv  nonresidential mobile trailers license required no nonresidential mobile trailer shall be permitted in the city unless a license for its operation is issued by the city clerk after inspection by the inspection officer such license shall specify the permitted use of the nonresidential mobile trailer the location of such operation and the termination date of the permit no license shall be issued for a use which would violate any city state or federal ordinance law or regulation    license fee an annual fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule shall be charged for each nonresidential mobile trailer license however no governmental or nonprofit agency shall be charged such a fee    use on construction projects operation of a nonresidential mobile trailer by a contractor on a construction project for which building permits have been issued or which is otherwise approved by governmental units is permitted during the term of such construction project without issuance of a license    permanent location this article is not to be construed as permitting or authorizing the permanent location of any nonresidential mobile trailer in the city    secs 189518120  reserved article v  mobilemanufactured home parks and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks division 1  generally supervision under this article the licensee or permittee or a duly authorized attendant or caretaker shall be in charge at all times to keep a mobilemanufactured home park its facilities and equipment in a clean orderly and sanitary condition the attendant or caretaker shall be answerable with the licensee or permittee for the violation of any section of this chapter to which the licensee or permittee is subject    existing parks  expansions mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks in existence upon the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived which have concrete pads indicating the location of mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces need not comply with those sections of this chapter which would require the moving of concrete pads any park expansion shall be in full compliance with this chapter    fuel piping and storage all piping from outside fuel storage tanks or cylinders to mobilemanufactured homes shall be of acceptable material as determined by the inspection officer and shall be permanently installed and securely fastened in place all fuel storage tanks or cylinders shall be securely fastened in place and shall not be located inside or beneath the mobilemanufactured home or less than five feet from any mobilemanufactured home exit    secs 1812418150  reserved division 2  license required a it shall be unlawful for any person to construct maintain or operate any mobilemanufactured home park or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park within the city limits unless he holds a valid license issued annually by the city clerk in the name of such person for the specific mobilemanufactured home park b an application shall be made to the city clerk who acting jointly with the inspection officer shall issue a license upon compliance by the applicant with all pertinent sections of this chapter and other city ordinances and regulations every person holding such a license shall notify the city clerk in writing within 24 hours after having sold transferred given away or otherwise disposed of interest in or control of any mobilemanufactured home park such notice shall include the name and address of the person succeeding to the ownership or control of such mobilemanufactured home park or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park    application for original and renewal licenses a an application for an original license required under this division shall be in writing signed by the applicant and accompanied by an affidavit of the applicant as to the truth of the application and shall contain the following 1 the name and address of the applicant  2 the interest of the applicant in and the location and legal description of the park  3 a complete plan of the park showing compliance with all applicable sections of this chapter and regulations promulgated under this chapter  and 4 such further information as may be requested by the inspection officer b application for a renewal of the license shall be made in writing by the holder of the license and shall contain the following 1 any change in the information submitted since the time the original license was issued or the latest renewal granted  and 2 other information requested by the inspection officer    plan of park a complete plan for the purpose of obtaining a license to be issued under this division shall show the following 1 the area and dimensions of the tract of land  2 the number location and size of all mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces  3 the location and width of roadways walkways buffer strips and recreational areas  4 the location of service buildings and other proposed structures  5 the location and size of utility lines and treatment facilities  and 6 plans and specifications of all buildings and other improvements constructed or to be constructed within the park    fees the city clerk shall charge and collect for each mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park an initial license fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule for up to 30 spaces and a fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule per space for all over 30 spaces the initial license shall expire one year from the date of issue unless renewed upon such conditions as the city commission may by ordinance direct the annual renewal fee shall be in an amount as described in the city fee schedule per space    posting the license certificate issued under this division shall be conspicuously posted in the office or on the premises of the mobilemanufactured home park or the travel trailerrecreational vehicle park at all times    notice of violation  compliance whenever the inspection officer finds conditions existing in violation of this chapter or of any regulation adopted pursuant to this chapter he shall give notice in writing to the person to whom the license was issued that unless such conditions or practices are corrected within a reasonable period of time specified in the notice the license will be suspended at the end of such period not to exceed 90 days the inspection officer shall reinspect the park and if such conditions or practices have not been corrected he shall suspend the license and give notice in writing of such suspension to the person to whom the license was issued upon receipt of notice of suspension such person shall cease operation of such park except as provided in section 1832    hearing following denial or suspension or receipt of notice to correct violation any person whose license issued under this division has been denied or suspended or who has received notice from the inspection officer that his license will be suspended unless certain conditions or practices at the park are corrected may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the city commission however when no petition for such hearing shall have been filed within ten days following the day on which notice of suspension was served such license shall be deemed to have been automatically revoked at the expiration of the tenday period    secs 1815818185  reserved division 3  inspections purpose the inspection officer is authorized and directed to make inspections to determine the condition of mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks located within the city in order to perform his duty of safeguarding the health and safety of occupants of mobilemanufactured home parks and of the general public    outside premises of private or public property the inspection officer shall have the power to inspect the outside premises of private or public property for the purposes of inspecting and investigating conditions relating to the enforcement of this chapter or of regulations promulgated under this chapter    register of mobilemanufactured homes and occupants the inspection officer shall have the power to inspect the register containing a record of all mobilemanufactured homes and occupants using the park    access of owner for repairs it shall be the duty of every occupant of a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park to give the owner thereof or his agent or employee access to any part of such park or its premises at reasonable times for the purpose of making such repairs or alterations as are necessary to effect compliance with this chapter or with any lawful order issued pursuant to this chapter    secs 1819018215  reserved division 4  registration of owners and occupants of mobilemanufactured homes and travel trailersrecreational vehicles information in register each licensee under this article shall keep a register containing a record of all mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle owners and occupants located within the park the register shall contain the following information 1 the name and address of the owner or occupant of each mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle and motor vehicle by which it is towed  2 the make model year and license of each mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle and motor vehicle  3 the state territory or country issuing such license  4 the date of arrival and of departure of each mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle  and 5 whether or not each mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle is a dependent or independent mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle    inspection of register the mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall keep the register available for inspection at all times by law enforcement officers inspection officers and other officials whose duties necessitate acquisition of the information contained in the register the register record of each occupant registered shall not be destroyed for a period of one year following the date of departure of the registrant from the park    secs 1821818245  reserved division 5  location space and general layout types of parks a under this article parks shall be of three types as follows 1 mobilemanufactured home parks  2 travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks  and 3 mixed mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks b no travel trailerrecreational vehicle shall be located in a mobilemanufactured home park no mobilemanufactured home shall be located in a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park in a mixed park separate areas shall be reserved for mobilemanufactured homes and for travel trailersrecreational vehicles  no mobilemanufactured home shall be permitted in the travel sector  no travel trailerrecreational vehicle shall be permitted in the mobilemanufactured home sector    drainage of site every mobilemanufactured home park shall be located on a welldrained site properly graded to ensure rapid drainage and free from stagnant pools of water drainage shall not endanger any water supply    minimum area the minimum area of any mobilemanufactured home park shall be five acres however parks in existence on the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived may continue to operate with less than five acres however if the park is to be expanded it must at that time have a minimum of five acres    intensity of development intensity of development for a mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be limited to no more than ten mobilemanufactured homes per gross acre for a mobilemanufactured home park and no more than 15 travel trailersrecreational vehicles per gross acre for a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park the area used for sewage treatment facilities shall not be included in density computations mobilemanufactured home spaces shall be at least 30 feet wide where pads are closest to driveways travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces shall be at least 25 feet wide where travel trailersrecreational vehicles are located closest to the driveway    spaces generally every mobilemanufactured home space and travel trailerrecreational vehicle space shall be clearly defined mobilemanufactured homes and travel trailersrecreational vehicles shall be parked in such spaces that at the nearest point they shall be ten feet from the service road five feet from the rear lot line and at least ten feet from any other mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle    distance of mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle from street it shall be unlawful for any person to locate a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle less than 25 feet from any public street or highway rightofway or so that any part of such mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle will obstruct any roadway or walkway of such park    occupancy of designated spaces it shall be unlawful for any person to permit a mobilemanufactured home to occupy a travel trailerrecreational vehicle space a travel trailerrecreational vehicle to occupy a mobilemanufactured home space and for any mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle to be located in a park unless in a designated mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle space    abutting driveway to mobilemanufactured home space all mobilemanufactured home spaces shall abut upon a sealedsurface driveway of not less than 20 feet in width if onstreet parking is prohibited and 26 feet in width if onstreet parking is permitted on one side of the street only driveways must have unobstructed access to a public street or highway    parking a in a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park existing at the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived parking on or adjacent to the street within the park is permissible as long as it does not obstruct free movement of traffic whether or not a safety hazard exists is a question to be determined by the inspection officer with final appeal to the city commission if upon final appeal before the city commission it is determined by the commission that a safety hazard does in fact exist the mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park concerned will be required to comply with subsection b of this section b in new mobilemanufactured home parks at least two clearly defined parking spaces will be provided for each space either on or adjacent to the space in new travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks at least one parking space shall be provided for each space either on or adjacent to the space    clothes drying facilities outside drying spaces or other clothes drying facilities shall be provided in every mobilemanufactured home park or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park mobilemanufactured home parks shall have at least 100 linear feet of clothes drying line or one mechanical clothes drying unit in good condition  mechanical units shall be located in a service building travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks and mixed parks shall have at least 25 linear feet of outdoor clothes drying line for each travel trailerrecreational vehicle space or one mechanical clothes drying unit for the first ten travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces or any fraction thereof and an additional unit for each ten additional travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces or any fraction thereof    composition of driveways walkways all driveways and walkways within a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be at least asphaltoilrock sealed surface    ingress and egress in the urban area new mobilemanufactured home parks should abut and have their major means of ingress and egress on at least a minor arterial street travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks and mixed parks in the urban area shall abut and have their major means of ingress and egress on at least a principal arterial street    buffer planting strip along certain boundaries all mobilemanufactured home parks shall have and maintain a buffer planting strip not less than three feet in width along all park boundaries not bordering a street such strip shall consist of not less than one row of shrubs spaced not more than eight feet apart which grow to a height of five feet or more in one full growing season and which will eventually grow to a height of not less than 12 feet    secs 1825918285  reserved division 6  service buildings for travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks required a each travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be provided with at least one service building adequately equipped with flushtype toilet fixtures and other sanitary facilities as required in this chapter no service building shall contain less than one toilet for females one toilet for males one lavatory and shower or bathtub for each sex and one laundry tray b all sanitary facilities required by section 18288 shall be located in service buildings    requirements service buildings in a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall 1 be located 25 feet or more from any travel trailerrecreational vehicle space  2 be of permanent construction and adequately lighted  3 be of moistureresistant material to permit frequent washing and cleansing  4 have adequate heating facilities to maintain a temperature of 70 degrees fahrenheit during cold weather and to supply adequate hot water during times of peak demands  and 5 have all rooms well ventilated with all openings effectively screened    sanitary facilities each park accommodating travel trailersrecreational vehicles shall provide the following 1 toilet facilities for males shall consist of not less than two flush toilets and one urinal for the first ten travel trailersrecreational vehicles or fraction thereof and for travel trailersrecreational vehicles in excess of ten not less than one additional flush toilet and one additional urinal for every ten additional travel trailersrecreational vehicles or fractional number thereof 2 toilet facilities for females shall consist of not less than two flush toilets for the first six travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces or any less number thereof and for travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces in excess of six not less than one additional flush toilet for every ten additional travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces in excess of six or fractional number thereof 3 each sex shall be provided with not less than two lavatories and two showers or bathtubs with individual dressing accommodations for the first ten travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces or any less number thereof and for travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces in excess of ten not less than one additional lavatory and one additional shower or bathtub with individual dressing accommodations for every ten additional travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces or fractional number thereof 4 each toilet for females and each shower or bathtub with individual dressing accommodations for females shall be in a private compartment or stall 5 the toilet and other sanitation facilities for males and females shall be either separate buildings or shall be separated if in the same building by a soundproof wall 6 there shall be provided in a separate compartment or stall not less than one flush toilet bowl receptacle for emptying bedpans and other containers of human excreta or a slop sink with at least a threeinch trap and an adequate supply of hot running water for cleaning such bedpans or containers    maximum distance from trailer spaces travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces in a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall not be more than 200 feet from a service building    laundry facilities laundry facilities in a travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be provided in the ratio of one laundry unit to every 30 travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces and shall be in a separate soundproof room of a service building or in a separate building a laundry shall consist of not less than one laundry tub and one clothes washing machine    maintenance of service buildings and grounds all service buildings and the grounds of the travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be maintained in a clean sightly condition and kept free of any condition that will menace the health of any occupant or the public    secs 1829218320  reserved division 7  sewage disposal discharge of waste from service and other buildings waste from showers bathtubs flush toilets urinals lavatories slop sinks and laundries in service and other buildings within the mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be discharged into a public sewer and disposal plant septic tank system or private sewer and lagoon system of such construction and in such manner as approved by the state health department and in accordance with all applicable sections of this other city ordinances    sewer connection at each space each mobilemanufactured home space shall be provided with at least a threeinch sewer connection at least four inches above the surface of the ground the sewer connection should be protected by a concrete collar at least four inches thick and with a minimum outside diameter of 24 inches the sewer connection shall be fitted with a standard ferrule and close nipple and provided with a screw cap the connection between the mobilemanufactured home drain and the sewer must be watertight and selfdraining mobilemanufactured homes with fixtures from which backsiphonage may occur shall not be connected to the parks water system until the defect has been corrected    connection to public sewer system if a public sewer system is or becomes available within 300 feet of a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park a connection must be made to the public system within 180 days    sewage treatment facilities the design of private sewage treatment facilities shall be based on the maximum capacity of the mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park effluents from sewage treatment facilities shall not be discharged into the watershed of the shawnee twin lakes or into any other waters of the state the disposal facilities shall be located where they will not create a nuisance or health hazard to the mobilemanufactured home park or to the owner or occupant or any adjacent property the state health department must approve the type of treatment proposed and the design of any disposal facilities and sewer systems prior to construction    dumping of accumulated waste every mobilemanufactured home occupying a mobilemanufactured home park space shall tie into the park sewer system and shall dump any accumulated waste into the system every travel trailerrecreational vehicle shall dump any accumulated waste into a receptacle provided in the travel trailerrecreational vehicle park upon entering and upon leaving the park such receptacles must be approved by the state health department any other dumping of accumulated waste within the city is prohibited    monthly sewerage charge the monthly sewerage charge shall be based on the maximum mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle capacity of the park the park operator shall by the tenth of each month notify the city clerk of the maximum number of mobilemanufactured home spaces in use at any time during the previous month the city clerk shall then adjust the sewerage fee to the actual use of the park if the park operator fails to notify the city clerk of the prior months actual usage of trailer or mobilemanufactured home spaces the sewerage fee shall be levied on the maximum capacity of the park    condition of sewer connections sewer connections in a mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park shall be watertight the park licensee shall maintain trailer and mobilemanufactured home connections to sewer and water systems in good condition and shall be responsible that there is no sewage or water leakage on park premises    sewer connections to travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces no sewer connections shall be made to travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces    secs 1832918355  reserved division 8  water supply for mobilemanufactured home parks use of public or private source of water an accessible adequate safe and potable supply of water shall be provided in each mobilemanufactured home park capable of furnishing a maximum of 250 gallons per day per mobilemanufactured home space where a public supply of water of such quality is available within 300 feet or becomes available within 300 feet a connection shall be made thereto and its supply shall be used exclusively where private water supplies must be developed the inspection officer must approve the location construction and development of both the water well and pipe system and connections no private source other than a water well shall be used    connections to buildings and spaces the water system of the mobilemanufactured home park shall be connected by pipes to all buildings and all mobilemanufactured home spaces storage buildings excepted each mobilemanufactured home shall be provided with a cold water tap at least four inches above the ground an adequate supply of hot water shall be provided at all times in the service buildings for all bathing washing cleansing and laundry facilities    construction and maintenance of water piping all water piping in a mobilemanufactured home park shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with state and local law the water piping system shall not be connected with nonpotable or questionable water supplies and the system shall be protected against the hazards of backflow or backsiphonage all water connections shall be weathertight    drinking fountains where drinking fountains are provided for public use in a mobilemanufactured home park they shall be of a type and in locations approved by the inspection officer    individual water service connections individual water service connections which are provided for direct use by mobilemanufactured homes or travel trailersrecreational vehicles shall be of such construction that they will not be damaged by the parking of such mobilemanufactured homes or travel trailersrecreational vehicles the park system shall be adequate to provide 20 pounds per square inch of pressure at all mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle connections    water supply to travel trailerrecreational vehicle space provision shall be made within 150 feet of each travel trailerrecreational vehicle space to supply water for travel trailerrecreational vehicle reservoirs    location of pumping machinery and pipes in a mobilemanufactured home park no well casing pumps pumping machinery or suction pipes shall be located in any pit room or space extending below ground level or in any room or space above ground which is walled in or otherwise enclosed unless such room whether above or below ground has free drainage by gravity to the surface all floors shall be watertight and sloped from the pump pedestal to the drain and floors shall extend at least two feet from the well in all directions the pedestal shall not be less than 12 inches above the floor this shall not be construed as prohibiting submersible pumps    requirements for water storage reservoirs all water storage reservoirs in a mobilemanufactured home park shall be watertight and constructed of impervious material all overflows and vents of such reservoirs shall be effectively screened open reservoirs are prohibited manholes shall be constructed with overlapping covers so as to prevent the entrance of contaminated material overflow pipes from a reservoir shall not connect to any pipe in which sewage or polluted water may back up    installation of stopcocks and wastecocks underground stopcocks and wastecocks shall not be installed on any connection in a mobilemanufactured home park    water wells drawing water from sands reserved to city under this article no water well shall draw water from any sands reserved to the city for its use except as may be otherwise permitted by this city ordinances    water connection to travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces no water connections shall be made to travel trailerrecreational vehicle spaces    secs 1836718395  reserved division 9  refuse disposal for mobilemanufactured home parks sanitary and safety conditions the storage collection and disposal of refuse in the mobilemanufactured home park shall be so managed as to create no health hazards rodent harborage insectbreeding areas accident fire hazards or air pollution    storage of refuse in proper containers all refuse shall be stored in flytight watertight rodentproof containers which shall be located within 150 feet of any mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle space containers shall be provided in sufficient numbers and capacity to properly store all refuse    racks or holders for refuse containers in a mobilemanufactured home park racks or holders shall be provided for all refuse containers such container racks or holders shall be so designed as to prevent containers from being tipped to minimize spillage and container deterioration and to facilitate cleaning around them lids for containers shall be permanently connected to racks or holders with chains or other flexible materials    municipal or private collection under this article all refuse shall be collected at least once weekly or as otherwise required by the inspection officer where municipal garbage collection is not available the mobilemanufactured home park operator shall either employ a private agency or provide this service all refuse shall be collected and transported in covered vehicles or covered containers    burial or transporting of refuse where a municipal or private disposal service is not available the mobilemanufactured home park operator shall dispose of refuse by burial or by transporting to a site approved by the state health department refuse shall be buried only at locations and by methods approved by the state health department and in accordance with this code and city ordinances and state health department regulations    use of city disposal service when a municipal refuse disposal service is available for a mobilemanufactured home park it must be used    secs 1840218430  reserved division 10  insect and rodent control measures for control generally a insect and rodent control measures to safeguard public health as required by the inspection officer shall be applied in the mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle park b the inspection officer may require the park operator to take suitable measures to control other insects and obnoxious weeds a c   larvicidal solutions effective larvicidal solutions may be required by the inspection officer for fly or mosquito breeding areas in the mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park which cannot be controlled by other more permanent measures b   accumulations of debris accumulations of debris which may provide harborage for rodents shall not be permitted in the mobilemanufactured home park    extermination of rodents when rats or other objectionable rodents are known to be in the mobilemanufactured home or travel trailerrecreational vehicle park the park operator shall take definite action as directed by the inspection officer to exterminate them    secs 1843518460  reserved division 11  electricity and exterior lighting electrical outlets and equipment an electrical outlet supplying at least 60 amperes shall be provided for each mobilemanufactured home space the installation shall comply with all applicable state and local electrical codes and ordinances such electrical outlets and extension lines shall be grounded and weatherproofed plug receptacles shall also be grounded and weatherproofed no power supply line shall be permitted to lie on the ground and no main power line shall be suspended less than 18 feet above the ground unless otherwise approved by the inspection officer    streetlights streets and driveways within mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks shall be lighted with streetlights meeting the current standards of the illuminating engineering society or onehalf candlepower whichever is higher    secs 1846318490  reserved division 12  fire protection flammable materials mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle park areas shall be kept free of litter rubbish and other flammable materials    water risers where the water supply system does not provide at least sixinch water mains there shall be provided a twoinch frostprotected water riser within 300 feet of each mobilemanufactured home or building    fires generally fires shall be made only in stoves and other cooking or heating equipment intended for such purposes in mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks    secs 1849418520  reserved division 13  alterations and additions plumbing and electrical alterations or repairs all plumbing and electrical alterations or repairs in mobilemanufactured home and travel trailerrecreational vehicle parks shall be made in accordance with applicable local regulations    skirting of mobilemanufactured homes skirting of mobilemanufactured homes is permissible but areas enclosed by such skirting shall be maintained so as not to provide a harborage for rodents or create a fire hazard    permit for exterior construction a permit issued by the inspection officer shall be required before any construction on a mobilemanufactured home space or any structural addition or alteration to the exterior of a mobilemanufactured home takes place no construction or addition or alteration to the exterior of a mobilemanufactured home located in a mobilemanufactured home park shall be permitted unless of the same type of construction or materials as the mobilemanufactured home affected all such construction additions or alterations shall be in compliance with applicable local and state laws no permit shall be required for the addition of steps canopies awnings or antennas    additional structures on mobilemanufactured home space no structure other than a mobilemanufactured home shall be permitted on a mobilemanufactured home space except that one structure of not to exceed 175 cubic feet may be used for storage on each such space    secs 1852518550  reserved article vi  minimum housing regulations compliance with housing code generally every mobilemanufactured home located in either a mobilemanufactured home park a mobilemanufactured home subdivision or as a freestanding mobilemanufactured home shall meet the provisions of the city housing code except as otherwise provided in this article    applicability of housing code to travel trailersrecreational vehicles the housing code shall not apply to travel trailersrecreational vehicles insofar as floor area flush toilet bath or shower or ceiling height is concerned    minimum gross floor area or habitable space a every mobilemanufactured home shall contain the following minimum gross floor area or habitable space 1 for one or two occupants 150 square feet 2 for a third occupant 100 additional square feet 3 for each additional occupant thereafter 75 square feet additional b habitable space in a mobilemanufactured home shall have a minimum ceiling height of seven feet over 50 percent of the floor area and the floor area where the ceiling height is less than five feet shall not be considered in computing minimum gross floor area    primary and emergency exits a mobilemanufactured home shall have a safe and unobstructed primary exit and an emergency exit located remote from the primary exit    area of rooms occupied for sleeping purposes rooms in a mobilemanufactured home occupied for sleeping purposes must contain at least 60 square feet of floor space if used by more than one person and at least 40 square feet if used by one person    sanitary facilities of dependent mobilemanufactured homes dependent mobilemanufactured homes shall not be required to have a flush toilet or a bath or shower    secs 1855718585  reserved article vii  mobilemanufactured home subdivisions compliance with subdivision ordinance and zoning code mobilemanufactured home subdivisions shall comply with the city subdivision ordinance and the zoning code except as otherwise provided in this article    minimum size the minimum size of a mobilemanufactured home subdivision shall be ten acres    residences permitted no residences except mobilemanufactured homes shall be permitted in a mobilemanufactured home subdivision    minimum lot widths and areas minimum effective lot widths in a mobilemanufactured home subdivision shall be 40 feet measured at the front building line and minimum lot areas shall be 4000 square feet at least a fivefoot side yard shall be provided on each lot beyond any mobilemanufactured home and additions thereto in areas not serviced by a public sewer the minimum additional lot area shall be determined by the inspection officer on the basis of safe and sanitary sewer service the effective lot width of a mobilemanufactured home lot shall be determined for interior lots by measuring at right angles across the lot from one diagonal sideline to the other and for corner lots the measurement shall be made at right angles from the diagonal having the greatest divergence from perpendicular to the street midpoint of the rear line of the required front yard to the opposite lot line or an extension thereof    side lot lines sidelines of lots in mobilemanufactured home subdivisions need not be at right angles to straight street lines or radial to curved street lines    abut public street for certain distance regardless of the effective lot width mobilemanufactured home subdivision lots must abut a public street for at least 25 feet    greenbelt planting strips all mobilemanufactured home subdivisions except those developed under residential estate standards shall have a greenbelt planting strip not less than ten feet in width along all subdivision boundaries such greenbelt shall be composed of not less than three rows of shrubs spaced not more than eight feet apart and which grow to a height of five feet or more after one full growing season and which will eventually grow to a height of not less than 12 feet    motor vehicles and traffic footnotes  1  state law reference municipal traffic regulations 11 os  22117  motor vehicles 47 os property lines intended for use of pedestrians stop or stopping when required means complete cessation from movement  when prohibited any halting even momentarily of a vehicle whether occupied or not state law reference similar provisions 47 os  1160411606 operation of vehicles at railroad crossings a whenever any person driving a vehicle approaches a railroad grade crossing under any of the circumstances stated in this section the driver of such vehicle shall stop within 50 feet but not less than 15 feet from the nearest rail of such railroad and shall not proceed until he can do so safely this requirement shall apply when 1 a clearly visible electric or mechanical signal device gives warning of the immediate approach of a railroad train 2 a crossing gate is lowered or when a human flagman gives or continues to give a signal of the approach or passage of a railroad train 3 a railroad train approaching within approximately 1500 feet of the highway crossing emits a signal audible from such distance and such railroad train because of its speed or nearness to such crossing is an immediate hazard 4 an approaching railroad train is plainly visible and is in hazardous proximity to such crossing b no person shall drive any vehicle around or under any crossing gate or barrier at a railroad crossing while such gate or barrier is closed or is being opened or closed c the driver of any motor vehicle carrying passengers for hire or of any school bus carrying any school child or of any vehicle carrying explosive substances or flammable liquids as a cargo or part of a cargo before crossing at grade any track of a railroad shall stop such vehicle within 50 feet but not less than 15 feet from the nearest rail of such railroad and while so stopped shall listen and look in both directions along such track for any approaching train and for signals indicating the approach of a train except as provided in this section and shall not proceed until he can do so safely after stopping as required in this subsection and upon proceeding when it is safe to do so the driver of any such vehicle shall cross only in such gear of the vehicle that there will be no necessity for changing gears while traversing such crossing and the driver shall not shift gears while crossing the tracks d no stop need be made at any such crossing where a police officer or a traffic control signal directs traffic to proceed    state law reference similar provisions 47 os  11701 11702 meeting or overtaking stopped school bus a the driver of a vehicle meeting or overtaking a school bus means of marking parked vehicles in order to identify vehicles that are parked overtime such persons shall patrol such areas in accordance with the schedules prepared by the city manager such vehicles spaces and vehicles determines that a vehicle has been parked overtime he shall place on the vehicle a ticket indicating a violation if the vehicle remains parked in such place the person patrolling the spaces and vehicles is authorized to place additional tickets on the vehicle and each such ticket shall represent a separate violation any person violating this subsection shall be subject to a crossing of such bridge by such vehicle will not likely cause damage to it the city manager may issue a special permit to the applicant to cross the bridge however no such permit shall be issued until the applicant has executed an indemnity agreement agreeing to indemnify and save harmless the city and all other persons from damages or injuries caused by such vehicle crossing or attempting to cross the bridge d any person who violates this section shall be deemed guilty of an offense and upon conviction shall be fined in an amount as described in the city fee schedule plus costs or imprisonment chapter it shall determine and declare the maximum speed of vehicles which such structure can safely withstand and may cause and permit suitable signs stating such maximum speed to be erected and reasonable regulation prescribed for the conduct of passengers if such vehicle has first been stopped and the force and violence used is not more than is sufficient to expel the offending passenger school by reason of mental or physical disability to be determined by the board of education of the district upon a certificate of the school physician or public health physician or if no such physician is available a duly licensed and practicing physician  2 if any child is excused from attendance at school due to an emergency by the principal teacher of the school in which such child is enrolled at the request of the parent guardian custodian or other person having control of such child  3 if any child who has attained his or her sixteenth birthday is excused from attending school by written joint agreement between a the school administrator of the school district where the child attends school and b the parent guardian or custodian of the child provided further that no child shall be excused from attending school by such joint agreement between a school administrator and the parent guardian or custodian of the child unless and until it has been determined that such action is for the best interest of the child andor the community and that said child shall thereafter be under the supervision of the parent guardian or custodian until the child has reached the age of 18 years  4 if any child is excused from attending school for the purpose of observing religious holy days if before the absence the parent guardian or person having custody or control of the student submits a written request for the excused absence the school district shall excuse a student pursuant to this subsection for the days on which the religious holy days are observed and for the days on which the student must travel to and from the site where the student will observe the holy days  or 5 if any child is excused from attending school for the purpose of participating in a military funeral honors ceremony upon approval of the school principal c it shall be the duty of the attendance officer to enforce the provisions of this section in the prosecution of a parent guardian or other person having custody of a child for violation of any provision of this section it shall be an affirmative defense that the parent guardian or other person having custody of the child has made substantial and reasonable efforts to comply with the compulsory attendance requirements of this section but is unable to cause the child to attend school if the court determines the affirmative defense is valid it shall dismiss the complaint against the parent guardian or other person having custody of the child and shall notify the school attendance officer who shall refer the child to the district attorney for the county in which the child resides for the filing of a child in need of supervision petition against the child pursuant to the oklahoma juvenile d any parent guardian custodian child or other person violating any of the provisions of this section upon conviction shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished as follows 1 for the first offense a fine of not less than $2500 nor more than $5000 or imprisonment for not more than five days or both such fine and imprisonment  2 for the second offense a fine of not less than $5000 nor more than $10000 or imprisonment for not more than ten days or both such fine and imprisonment  and 3 for the third or subsequent offense a fine of not less than $10000 nor more than $25000 or imprisonment for not more than 15 days or both such fine and imprisonment each day the child remains out of school after the oral and documented or written warning has been given to the parent guardian custodian child or other person or the child has been ordered to school by the juvenile court shall constitute a separate offense e at the trial of any person charged with violating the provisions of this section the attendance records of the child or ward may be presented in court by any authorized employee of the school district f the court may order the parent guardian or other person having custody of the child to perform community service in lieu of the fine set forth in this section the court may require that all or part of the community service be performed for a public school district g the court may order as a condition of a deferred sentence or as a condition of sentence upon conviction of the parent guardian or other person having custody of the child any conditions as the court considers necessary to obtain compliance with school attendance requirements the conditions may include but are not limited to the following 1 verifying attendance of the child with the school  2 attending meetings with school officials  3 taking the child to school  4 taking the child to the bus stop  5 attending school with the child  6 undergoing an evaluation for drug alcohol or other substance abuse and following the recommendations of the evaluator  and 7 taking the child for drug alcohol or other substance abuse evaluation and following the recommendations of the evaluator unless excused definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning applies graffiti apply graffiti or applying graffiti means the act of drawing painting chiseling scratching or etching graffiti on public or private property within the city director means the director of the public works department or designee graffiti means without limitation any letter word name number symbol slogan message drawing picture writing or other mark of any kind visible to the public that is drawn painted chiseled scratched or etched on a rock tree wall bridge fence gate building or other structure however the term graffiti does not include advertising or any other letter word name number symbol slogan message drawing picture writing or other mark of any kind lawfully placed on property by an owner of the property or by an authorized agent for such owner or occupant occupant means any person shown by the records of the county clerks office as a tenant of property or any person in actual physical possession of property owner means any person shown by the records of the county clerks office as the owner of a fee simple interest in property removal remove or removed when used in relation to the eradication of graffiti means the act of taking graffiti off or masking the presence of graffiti on a rock tree wall bridge fence gate building or other structure    purpose and intent the purpose of this article is to provide for the prevention and removal of graffiti within the city the intent of the city commission is to prevent and remove a public nuisance that is a growing blight on and a substantial detriment to the health safety and general welfare of the community and its inhabitants    declaration of public nuisance the city commission declares that graffiti on public or private property within the city constitutes a public nuisance to the detriment of the city and its inhabitants and visitors the provisions for prevention and removal of such public nuisance are set forth in sections 20240 and 20241    application prohibited a no person welfare and to ensure orderly development along and near shawnee lake number 1 it is an overlay zone that is applied as specified below an overlay zone is a set of zoning standards and regulations that are applied in addition to the existing standards of the base zone a special zoning district is necessary to ensure adequate environmental protection for the shawnee lake number 1 which serves as a municipal water source for the city    972010 application the lpz overlay zone applies to all lake lot leases administered by the city and the state commissioners of the land office clo on shawnee chapter 7 sections 401410 of the state statutes is known as the zoning the city of shawnee and may be cited as such 1  exh 1 622014 purpose the regulations contained in this code are necessary to encourage the most appropriate uses of land  to maintain and stabilize the value of property  to reduce fire hazards and improve public safety and safeguard the public health  to decrease traffic congestion and its accompanying hazards  to prevent undue concentration of population  and to create a comprehensive and stable pattern of land uses upon which to plan for transportation water supply sewerage schools parks public facilities and other facilities in interpreting and applying the provisions of this code they shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety comfort convenience and general welfare 2  exh 1 622014 application this code classifies and regulates the land buildings and structures within the city limits set forth in this code the regulations contained in this code are necessary to promote health safety convenience and welfare to the inhabitants by dividing the city into zones and regulating therein the use of the land and the use and size of buildings as to height and number of stories the coverage of the land by buildings the size of yards and open spaces density of population and location of buildings 3  exh 1 622014 regulations of use height area yards and open spaces except as otherwise provided in this code no land shall be used and no building structure or improvement shall be made erected constructed moved altered enlarged or rebuilt which is designed arranged or intended to be used or maintained for any purpose or in any manner except in accordance with the requirements established in the district in which such land building structure or improvement is located in this code relating to any or all districts 4  exh 1 622014 final plats and development plans previously approved all final subdivision plats and site development plans conditional use permits and planned unit developments submitted prior to the effective date of this code shall remain valid and intact subject to those provisions in effect at the time of its approval 5  exh 1 622014 completion of approved buildings nothing herein shall require any change in the plans construction or designated use of a building or structure for which a building permit has been issued prior to the effective date of this code or an amendment to this code  provided that actual construction of such building or structure commences in accordance with these provisions in effect at that time of the permit issuance and provided further that such construction and proposed use of such building or structure is not in violation of any other ordinance or law on the effective date of this code 6  exh 1 622014 secs 2217622203  reserved division 2  definitions general provisions for the purpose of these regulations certain numbers abbreviations terms and words used herein shall be used interpreted and defined as set forth in this article 1  exh 1 622014 clarification and relationships of terms a for the purpose of these regulations words used in the present tense shall include the future tenses  words in the singular number shall include the plural and words in the plural shall include the singular except where the natural construction of the writing indicates otherwise the word shall is mandatory and not directory the word should is that which ought to occur but is not mandatory the word should allows for interpretation b the term person includes a corporation a partnership and an incorporated association of persons such as a club  the term a building includes a part thereof  the term used or occupied as applied to any land or building shall be construed to include the words intended arranged or designed to be used or occupied c words not herein defined shall conform to standard americanenglish usage d examples and lists shall not be considered to be all inclusive unless the content clearly states to the contrary 2  exh 1 622014 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accessory building or structure means a subordinate structure detached from but located on the same lot as a principle building the use of an accessory structure must be similar and accessory to the use of the principal building accessory structures include garages accessory dwelling unit means a second dwelling unit either in or added to an existing singlefamily detached dwelling or in a separate accessory structure on the same lot as the main dwelling for use as a complete independent living facility with provisions within the accessory apartment for cooking eating sanitation and sleeping such a dwelling is an accessory use to the main dwelling accessory use means a use that is incidental and subordinate to that of the main building or use of land and that is located on the same lot and under the same ownership in all respects administrative and professional office means uses that have very minimal impact to surrounding properties or the general public which usually have low traffic volume and common business hours if open to the public such as  am until  pm examples include but are not limited to banks general business offices accounting and tax preparation law offices etc the office may or may not be open to the general public adult companion home means any home or establishment funded and certified by the department of human services which provides homelike residential accommodations and supportive assistance to three or fewer developmentally disabled adults adult novelty store means a commercial establishment that displays sells or offers for sale instruments devices or paraphernalia designed or marketed primarily for use to stimulate human genital organs or for use in connection with sadomasochistic practices agricultural animals means animals which are considered accessory to an agricultural use whether for personal enjoyment or commercial purposes including horses mules burros sheep cattle rabbits chickens duck geese pigs goats ostrich or emus agriculture means the use of land for agricultural purposes including farming dairying pasturage apiculture horticulture floriculture viticulture and animal and poultry husbandry and the necessary accessory uses for packing treating or storing produce  providing however that the operation of any such accessory uses shall be secondary to that of the principal use the operation of commercial feed pens sales yards and auction yards for horses cattle or hogs is deemed an industrial and not an agricultural use alcohol mixed beverage establishment means a business which sells alcohol beverages by the individual drink for onpremises consumption whose alcohol sales make up more than 50 percent of sales typical uses might be a bar or nightclub alley means a minor rightofway dedicated to the public use not more than 30 feet wide affording a secondary means of access to abutting property and not intended for general traffic circulation animals grooming and sales means grooming of dogs cats and other small animals typical uses include dog bathing and clipping salons pet grooming shops or pet shops no medical training or boarding services are permitted auctioning means auctioning of livestock on a wholesale or retail basis with incidental onsite storage of animals on a temporary basis not to exceed 48hour periods typical uses include animal auctions livestock auctions or livestock auction yards assisted living facility means a special combination of housing supportive services personalized assistance and health care designed to respond to individual needs of those who need help with activities of daily living interpreted definition shall be consistent with oklahoma continuum of care and assisted living act automobile car wash means a building or structure designed primarily for washing automobiles using production line methods with a chain conveyor blowers steam cleaners high pressure spray or other mechanical devices a selfservice system may also be available for manual washing or vehicles automobile wrecking or salvage yard means an area outside of a building where motor vehicles are dissembled dismantled junked or wrecked or where motor vehicles not in operable condition or used parts of motor vehicles are stored basement means a story partly or wholly underground for purposes of height measurements a basement shall be counted as a story when more than onehalf of its height is above the average level of the adjoining ground or when subdivided and used for commercial or dwelling purposes other than by a janitor employed on the premises bed and breakfast means a dwelling or area containing one or more structures occupied by the owner where for compensation lodging and breakfast are provided for up to a maximum of six guest rooms per building  and the owner thereof intends that the same guest occupy the bed and breakfast facility for less than 30 days billboard including poster and panel types means a nonaccessory sign or sign structure upon which advertising may be posted painted or affixed and which is primarily designed for the rental or lease of the sign space for advertising not related to the use of the property upon which the sign is located block means in describing the boundaries of a district the term block refers to the legal description in all other cases the term block refers to the property abutting on one side of the street between two intersecting streets or between an intersection street and a railroad rightofway or between an intersecting street and a railroad rightofway or between an intersecting street and a watercourse board of adjustment means the board of adjustment of the city boardinghouse and roominghouse means a facility where meals or lodging are provided for persons other than the family or their relatives and excluding facilities for transient persons such as hotels motels inns and other such facilities building means any structure having a roof supported by columns or walls that is used or intended to be used for the shelter or enclosure of persons animals or property building coverage lot coverage means the percentage of the lot area covered by the building overhanging roofs are not included in the area building height means the vertical distance from the average line of the highest and lowest points of that portion of the lot covered by the building to the highest point of coping of a flat roof or the deckline of a mansard roof or the average height of the highest gable of a pitch or hip roof building line means a line established beyond which no part of a building shall project except as otherwise provided by this code building site means a lot or parcel of land in single or joint ownership and occupied or to be occupied by a main building and accessory buildings or by a dwelling group and its accessory buildings together with such open spaces as required by this land use code cellar means an underground structure separate from the foundation of the main building cemetery means land used or intended to be used for the burial of the human dead and dedicated for cemetery purposes excluding columbarium crematories mausoleums and mortuaries child care center means facilities which provide care and supervision of children and which operate more than 30 hours per week clinic means a place used for the care diagnosis and treatment of sick ailing infirm and injured persons and those in need of surgical or dominate form of care provided at the facility club means a nonprofit association of persons who are bona fide members paying regular dues and organized for some common purpose but not including a means the city planning director hereinafter referred to as the director comprehensive plan means the official plan of the city as adopted by the city commission continuum of care facility means a distance of a residential area court means an open unoccupied space other than a yard on the same lot with a building or group of buildings and which is bordered on two or more sides by such building this provision drinking establishment sitdown alcohol permitted means establishments or places of business where customers are seated and served and which are primarily engaged in the sale mixing or dwellings dwelling fourplex means a single structure containing four dwelling units dwelling modular means a relocatable living unit manufactured offsite and transported on an independent carrier unit to a permanent site which has been constructed in accordance with the adopted building code dwelling multifamily means a building containing four or more individual dwelling units with independent living facilities containing separate or joint entrances including apartments and condominiums dwelling singlefamily means a building containing one dwelling unit and designed for or used exclusively by one family dwelling townhouse means a building on its own separate lot containing one dwelling unit with a private entrance that occupies space from the ground to the roof and is attached to one or more other townhouse dwelling units by an approved wall dwelling triplex means a building containing three individual dwelling units dwelling twofamily means a building containing two dwellings and designed for or used exclusively by two families  the term twofamily dwelling also includes the term duplex dwelling unit means a room or group of rooms arranged intended or designed as a habitable unit containing kitchen bath and sleeping facilities for not more than one family living independent of any other family eating establishments sit down with no or incidental consumption of alcohol receipts from food and beverages all requirements of title 37 of the state statutes shall apply eating establishment drivein drivefastfood means restaurants where most customers order and are served
