site 2 the permittee shall submit a complete list of the proposed routes to and from the well site for all motor vehicles to be used to travel to and from the well site such list shall identify any and all highways within the city limits proposed to be used by such motor vehicles in traveling to and from the well site 3 the oil and gas inspector may also require any additional information which he deems necessary to evaluate the proposed routes b upon receipt of the notification required under subsection a of this section the oil and gas inspector shall have five working days to review the information submitted by the permittee c following review of the information submitted by the permittee the oil and gas inspector shall prepare a written order which either approves or disapproves the routes to and from the well site as proposed by the permittee if the oil and gas inspector disapproves of all or part of the proposed routes the inspector shall designate alternate routes which are acceptable to the city d during all drilling and production activities for the particular well all motor vehicles used by any person to travel to and from the well site shall be restricted to the highways approved by the oil and gas inspector as appropriate routes to and from the well site e the oil and gas inspector shall have the power and authority to amend the order designating routes to and from the well site upon his own initiative or upon application by the permittee    affidavit upon completion of well upon completion of the oil or gas well the operator shall certify by affidavit that the well has been set according to good engineering practices the affidavit shall stipulate the number of sacks of cement the class of cement blended materials weight of cement in pounds per gallon cement displacement pressure final pumping pressure and whether checkvalves float shoes float collar held the pressure commencement and completion times of such operation shall be stipulated the affidavit shall be completed by a cementing service company and signed by both the operator and the cementing service company the affidavit shall be submitted to the city geologist    ingress and egress lease roads to oil or gas wells shall be maintained in such manner as to safely and comfortably allow for ingress and egress of city or state personnel traveling in a common passenger motor vehicle    safety precautions persons drilling operating or maintaining any oil or gas well shall use all necessary care and shall take all precautions which shall be reasonably necessary under the circumstances to protect the public the sections of this chapter shall be deemed to be the minimum requirements for the preservation of the public health safety and welfare and compliance with the terms of this chapter shall not be deemed to relieve any person of any additional duty imposed by law    damage to public property any damage to paving sidewalks streets alleys curbing parking sewers or other public property arising out of any work relating to an oil or gas well shall be repaired immediately by the holder of the permit for such well and the repairs shall be made in accordance with requirements of the city manager or city engineer and under his supervision    noise and other nuisances all oil or gas well drilling and production operations shall be conducted in such a manner as to eliminate as far as possible dust noise vibration or noxious odors and shall be in accordance with the best available technology incident to exploration for drilling for and production of oil gas and other hydrocarbon substances proven technological improvements in exploration drilling and production methods shall be adopted as they became available if capable of reducing factors of nuisance and annoyance    fire prevention all permittees under this chapter shall maintain adequate firefighting apparatus and supplies at the well site at all times during drilling and production operations adequate firefighting apparatus and supplies shall include but shall not be limited to all of the following 1 during drilling operations the permittee shall provide a minimum of four portable fire extinguishers the size rating distribution and maintenance of which shall be in accordance with national fire protection association nfpa standard no 10 entitled portable fire extinguishers and nfpa standard no 30 entitled flammable liquids  2 in locations where flammable vapors may be present precautions shall be taken to prevent ignition by eliminating or controlling sources of ignition sources of ignition may include open flames lightning smoking cutting and welding hot surfaces frictional heat sparks static electrical and mechanical spontaneous ignition chemical and physicalchemical reactions and radiant heat national fire protection association standard no 77 recommended practice of static electricity and national fire protection association standard no 78 lightning protection provide information on such protection 3 the permittee shall protect all hazardous materials andor special hazards at the well site in accordance with applicable national fire protection association standards 4 the permittee shall also comply with such other requirements that the oil and gas inspector or the city fire marshal may prescribe for the particular well    drilling equipment a all drilling reentry and operations at any oil and gas well within the city limits shall be conducted in accordance with the best available technology all casing valves blowout preventers drilling fluids tubing bradenhead christmas trees and well head connections shall be of the type and quality consistent with the best available technology the setting and cementing of casing and running of drill stem tests shall be performed in a manner and at a time consistent with the best available technology all persons engaged in drilling or production operations shall observe and follow the recommendations or regulations of the american petroleum institute and the corporation commission except as specifically addressed by this chapter a copy of all logs associated with the surface casing shall be filed with the oil and gas inspector b blowout prevention equipment shall be used on all wells being drilled worked over or in which tubing is being changed wells being drilled shall have at least three hydraulically operated blowout preventers installed and these blowout preventers shall meet the american petroleum institute recommendation for class 3m blowout preventers wells being drilled shall also have a kill line chokeline and choke manifold which meet the recommendations of the american petroleum institute for class 3m blowout prevention equipment    surface casing and inspection a an oil or gas well in the city shall be cased and casing cemented from the top of such well hole to the depth not less than that recommended by the corporation commission and the city engineer such casing commonly referred to as surface pipe shall be set and cemented as stated in this subsection prior to drilling the well beyond the depth of the surface pipe b the permittee shall notify the city manager at least 24 hours prior to running the pipe for such work for the purpose of permitting the city manager or other authorized city representative to inspect such pipe on location and at least two hours and not more than three hours before commencing the procedure to cement the pipe the city manager shall be notified thereof in order that a city representative may observe the procedure no pipe shall be used unless approved by the city manager or other authorized city representative and the cementing of the pipe shall be done in the presence of such representative and approved by him c the depth of surface casing shall be determined by the corporation commission the cement used shall be class c and tested at 1500 pounds per square inch after 24 hours test results shall be forwarded to the city geologist or oil and gas inspector    pits steel mud or circulating pits shall be used for oil or gas wells such pits and contents shall be removed from the premises and the drilling site within 60 days after completion of the well no earthen pits shall be allowed unless small and temporary and approved in writing by the oil and gas inspector all such earthen pits must be lined and approved in writing by the oil and gas inspector catchbasin pits shall be used only for the purpose of catching any deleterious substance runoff and shall be not greater than 320 cubic feet emergency pits shall be emptied as soon as the emergency is over and all such pits shall be emptied and then leveled within 15 days after completion of the well    disposal of mud the disposal of drilling mud from an oil or gas well shall be by transporting the mud to a statelicensed disposal site the mud may not be buried in an earthen pit pumped down the well bore or down the annulus of a well or spread on the surface of the ground within the city limits    open hole formation or drill stem testing a all open hole formation or drill stem testing of an oil or gas well shall be done during daylight hours with adequate advance notification thereof to the city geologist to enable him to be present during such testing b all open hole formation or testing shall be done into steel tanks or flared properly in the case of gas    fracturing and acidizing in the completion of an oil and gas injection disposal or service well where acidizing or fracturing processes are used no oil gas or other deleterious substance or pollutant shall be permitted to pollute any surface or subsurface fresh waters    swabbing bailing and purging wells in swabbing bailing or purging an oil or gas well all deleterious substances removed from the bore hole shall be placed in appropriate tanks or pits and no substance shall be permitted to pollute any surface or subsurface fresh waters the permittee and operator shall also comply with article v of this chapter    rupture in surface or production casing if a rupture break or opening occurs in the surface or production casing of an oil or gas well the permittee or the operator or drilling contractor shall promptly report the incident to the oil and gas inspector immediate action shall be to repair such casing and the repairs witnessed by the oil and gas inspector    depositing substances no person shall deposit drain or divert into or upon any public highway street alley drainage ditch storm drain sewer gutter paving creek river lake or lagoon any oil or oily liquid with petroleum content or any mud rotary mud sand water or saltwater or in any manner permit by seepage overflow or otherwise any of such substances to escape from any property owned leased or controlled by such person and flow or be carried into or upon any public highway street alley drainage ditch storm drain sewer gutter paving creek river lake or lagoon within the city    flaring of gas all produced gas from an oil or gas well shall either be sold or flared with the flaring procedures being approved by the oil and gas inspector and the fire marshal    facilities a for oil or gas wells all lease equipment shall be painted and maintained in a good state of appearance and shall have posted in a prominent place a metal sign not less than two feet square in area which shall contain the following information the permittees name appropriate phone numbers lease name location of the drill site by reference to the united states survey and identifying numbers of all permits b the oil and gas inspector shall also have the power and authority to enforce orders of the city commission to require such general landscaping of any well site as it deems necessary the term general landscaping shall mean the aesthetic improvement of land by adding trees shrubs lawns ground cover etc c all pumps tanks and equipment used in the operation of a completed oil or gas well shall be enclosed on all sides by either a sightproof wooden stockade fence at least six feet in height or a woven wire fence of not less than ninegauge chainlink wire mesh of not less than two inches at least six feet high with additional angular extension outwardly secured by three strands of barbed wire such fence shall be constructed not less than three feet from outside the base of the embankment within 90 days of completion of the drill site or erection of storage tanks whichever occurs first during drilling operations a watchman shall be maintained on the premises at all times who will be charged with the responsibility of protecting the general public from any hazard resulting from the conduct of such drilling operations if such watchman is not employed the entire well location shall be fenced as in the operation of a completed well the oil and gas inspector is empowered to determine which type of fencing is best for any particular location    motive power motive power for all oil or gas well pumping equipment shall be electricity the oil and gas inspector shall have authority to waive the requirements of this section if he determines in a particular case that electric pumping equipment is not necessary to protect the public health safety or welfare    loss of well control if loss of control of any oil or gas well occurs the operator shall immediately take all reasonable steps to regain control of the well regardless of any other section of this chapter and shall notify the oil and gas inspector as soon as practicable after receipt of notice by his employees of the occurrence of such loss of well control endangering persons or property if and when the oil and gas inspector certifies in writing to the city clerk that in his opinion danger to persons or property exists because of the loss of well control briefly describing the circumstances and the operator is not taking or is unable to take all reasonable necessary steps to regain control of the well the oil and gas inspector may employ any well control experts or other contractors or suppliers of special services or may incur any other expenses for labor or material which the oil and gas inspector deems necessary to regain control of the well the city shall have a valid lien against the interest in the well of all working interest owners who have voluntarily joined in the drilling of the well to secure payment of any expenditure so made by the city pursuant to this section    storage tanks and separators a crude oil storage tanks shall not be constructed operated or used except to the extent of two lowtype steel tanks for oil storage not exceeding 500 barrels capacity each and constructed and maintained in accordance with the recommendations of the american petroleum institute it shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to locate a storage tank or separator site nearer than 150 feet to any residence or commercial or public building within the city b a permittee may use construct and operate a steel conventional separator and such other steel tanks and appurtenances as are necessary for treating oil all such facilities shall be constructed and maintained to control vapors each oil and gas separator shall be equipped with both a regulation pressure relief safety valve and a bursting head if excessive vapors are released from the tanks the oil and gas inspector may require that a vapor recovery system be installed and operated to prevent the release of gas vapors into the atmosphere    impounding around tanks by diking when protection of adjoining property or waterways is by means of impounding by diking around the tanks of an oil or gas well such system shall comply with the following 1 a slope of not less than one percent away from the tank shall be provided for at least 50 feet or to the dike base whichever is less 2 the volumetric capacity of the diked area shall not be less than the greatest amount of liquid that can be released from the largest tank within the diked area assuming a full tank to allow for volume occupied by tanks the capacity of the diked area enclosing more than one tank shall be calculated after deducting the volume of the tanks other than the largest tank below the height of the dike 3 to permit access the outside base of the dike at ground level shall be not closer than ten feet to any property line that is or can be built upon 4 walls of the diked area shall be of earth steel concrete or solid masonry designed to be liquidtight and to withstand a full hydrostatic head earthen walls three feet or more in height shall have a flat section at the top not less than two feet wide the slope of an earthen wall shall be consistent with the angle of repose of the material of which the wall is constructed diked areas for tanks containing class i liquids located in extremely porous soils may require special treatment to prevent seepage of hazardous quantities of liquids to lowlying areas or waterways in case of spills 5 where provision is made for draining water from diked areas such drains shall be controlled in a manner so as to prevent flammable or combustible liquids from entering natural watercourses public sewers or public drains if their presence would constitute a hazard control of drainage shall be accessible under fire conditions from outside the dike 6 storage of combustible materials shall not be permitted within the diked area    leakage of deleterious substance if any leakage or spillage of any pollution or deleterious substance occurs from an oil or gas well whatever the cause thereof the permittee shall promptly notify the oil and gas inspector if in the judgment of the oil and gas inspector such leakage or spillage represents a potential environmental hazard he may issue whatever corrective orders he deems appropriate and additionally may require the appropriate testing of the surface and subsurface for pollutant incursion the cost of all such testing to be paid by the permittee    accumulation of vapor the oil and gas inspector shall have the authority to require the immediate shutting in or closing of any oil or gas well if he finds that there exists within a 100foot radius of any well any gas or gasoline vapor in a quantity sufficient to constitute in his judgement or in the judgment of the fire marshal a fire hazard the well shall remain shut in or closed in until the hazard and its cause have been remedied    inspection of pressure lines the oil and gas inspector shall inspect all pressure lines in use at any oil or gas well or at any project all tubing fittings equipment or connections shall be tight safe and free from leaks    burning of trash no permittee or any other person shall burn any trash or debris upon the oil or gas well site    surface facilities location whenever necessary to protect the health safety or welfare of the public the oil and gas inspector is authorized to direct any permittee or operator to locate relocate remove or replace any oil or gas well surface facilities located within a particular drilling unit    abandonment and plugging  permit a every person owning or operating any oil or gas well and the officers agents and employees of such person shall begin removing all derricks machinery concrete foundations and any and all other objects that interfere with the leveling of the land within a period of 60 days from the day of abandonment of the well and shall remove such objects in a workmanlike manner such person shall also grade level and restore the land to a condition better than before the well was first commenced b whenever any well having sufficient surface casing to meet the requirements of this chapter is abandoned it shall also be the duty of the permittee and the operator of the well to set a 200foot cement plug in the bottom of the surface casing with the bottom of the plug 100 feet below the surface casing section and to set a 50foot cement plug in the top of the surface casing a 200foot cement plug shall also be placed in the well bore within 100 feet of the shallowest zone known to produce hydrocarbons in the area the oil and gas inspector may require that the two lowermost cement plugs be tested applying drill string weight on the cement plug after the cement has set to confirm that the plug has hardened and is in the correct location when any cement plug is found to be deficient an additional cement plug shall be placed in the well bore or other appropriate corrective action shall be taken no surface or conductor string of casing may be pulled or removed from a well during initial abandonment operations it shall also be the duty of the permittee and operator to flood the well with mudladen fluid this fluid shall have a density of not less than nine pounds per gallon and a viscosity of not less than 36 funnel seconds as measured with a standard marsh funnel however in no case shall the density of this mud be less than the density of the mud used to complete the drilling of the well or less than the density required to create sufficient hydrostatic pressure to prevent the well from attempting to kick or flow prior to commencing plugging operations the oil and gas inspector shall be notified so that he may witness the plugging operations c whenever a permittee or operator desires to abandon and plug any well drilled within the city except a dry hole the permittee or operator shall apply to the city clerk for a permit to plug the well the application for the permit to plug the well shall be on forms provided by the oil and gas inspector and shall be accompanied by a permit fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule in the application for a permit to plug a well the applicant shall include evidence of the depth of the base of the fresh water in the vicinity of the well copies of all corporation commission reports filed on the well a well bore diagram showing the present condition of the well and a well bore diagram showing the proposed plugged condition of the well copies of any temperature surveys or cement bond logs run to determine the top of the cement outside the casing strings shall be included in the permit application d whenever any well having a lesser amount of surface casing than required by this chapter is abandoned it shall be the duty of the permittee or operator of the well to plug the well in accordance with this subsection to effect the plugging of the well the production casing shall be cut at a depth at least 200 feet deeper than the base of the freshwater zones and the upper section of the production casing shall be removed from the well bore the well bore shall be reentered and circulated clean to the depth of at least 200 feet below the base of the freshwater zones a cement plug shall be placed in the well bore with the bottom of the plug located at the top of the production casing stub and the top of the plug located at least 100 feet inside the surface casing if the production casing cannot be removed as required the operator or permittee shall propose an alternative plugging procedure but no plugging may be performed unless the procedure has been approved by the oil and gas inspector the oil and gas inspector shall be notified so that he may witness the plugging of the well the remainder of the plugging requirements for wells not having sufficient surface casing shall be the same as for wells which do have sufficient surface casing e in exceptional circumstances the oil and gas inspector shall have authority to approve plugging procedures other than those set forth in this section such approval shall be in writing and shall be signed by the oil and gas inspector    secs 2813228160  reserved article iv  swabbing wells compliance no person shall begin the operation of swabbing an oil or gas well without first complying with the provisions of this article    lubricator no oil or gas well shall be swabbed before a device commonly known as a lubricator has been placed on the flow casing above all outlets or flow lines of the well the lubricator shall be not less in diameter than the flow casing and equipped with an adequate oil saver or stuffing box at the top the total inside length of the lubricator shall be not less than five feet more than the total length of swab and turn back on the swab line the lubricator shall have a nipple of not less than two inches in diameter and not more than four inches in length placed not more than six inches from the top and on the flow lines between the gate valve on the flow lines and flow casings the nipple shall be provided with a gate valve not less than two inches in size all equipment and parts of the lubricator shall be of a type designed and tested to withstand a pressure of 3000 pounds per square inch all pressure tests shall be by the hydrostatic method    valves on lines leaving flow casing all lines leaving the flow casing of any oil or gas well shall be equipped with a gate valve of not less than 3000 pounds per square inch test and the same size of the line and shall be placed not farther than 24 inches from the flow casing    deleterious substances in swabbing bailing or purging an oil or gas well all deleterious substances removed from the bore hole shall be placed in appropriate tanks and no substance shall be permitted to pollute any surface or subsurface fresh water    secs 2816528190  reserved article v  enhanced recovery system and disposal wells compliance  order to cease operation if the oil and gas inspector finds that any person is operating in violation of this article he in concert with the city manager shall order the activity to cease until compliance is made with this article no person shall renew such activity until the oil and gas inspector finds compliance has been made and permission given for the renewed activity any deviation from any approved plan of operations must be submitted to the oil and gas inspector for review and subsequently submitted to the city commission for approval    permit required a no person or operating company shall initiate any enhanced recovery system or reenter any oil or gas well or drill an original oil or gas well to be used for enhanced recovery purposes or disposal of saltwater or other deleterious substances without first obtaining the necessary permit therefor such permit shall consist of two separate parts as follows 1 permit to operate 2 permit to drill or reenter and construct b no person or operating company shall convert any well from natural or artificial production to be used for enhanced recovery or disposal without first obtaining the necessary permit therefor c no person shall reenter any abandoned or plugged and abandoned well or drill an original well to be used for enhanced recovery or disposal without first obtaining the necessary permit therefor    permit application an application for a permit as is required by section 28192 shall contain complete information required by the city manager and the oil and gas inspector including the following 1 a block map of each project well site showing all equipment to be used location of the pipeline access roads and distances from any well to any and all fences public roadways and buildings within a radius of 300 feet 2 a city street map of the project showing the location of the following a all supply disposal injection and producing wells b conduits c tank batteries d injection pumping station and appurtenant equipment e all wells in the project area and those located in the sections immediately adjacent to include producing plugged and abandoned and disposal f all public and domestic freshwater supply wells within 1000 feet of any proposed enhanced recovery project well or proposed disposal well g access roads 3 evidence that all wells in the project area and adjacent sections were plugged and abandoned in compliance with corporation commission regulations at the time well was plugged and abandoned a plugging record occ form 1003 to demonstrate compliance is acceptable 4 all wells associated with the enhanced recovery project shall be indicated by status eg plugged and abandoned injection water source oil etc and shall show the following information a surveyed surface location b footage location surface casing c derrick floor and ground level elevation new permitted wells d drilled total depth e size depth and quality of surface and production casing including zones from which casing has been removed f location of all plugs packers cement plugs tubing anchors etc within the well bore g packer body total depth h depth and nature of all cement squeeze operations i volume and type of cement used on surface and production strings j top of cement behind pipe k formation name and depth of all open perforations in a producing open hole 5 fee and operator name for each disposal well 6 one copy of all cement bond logs and production logs 7 one copy of all work performed on the well 8 copies of all information supplied to the corporation commission and such commissions approval of the project    application and inspection fee a each submitted application for an enhanced recovery project will be accompanied with a onetime fee in an amount as described in the city fee schedule a similar fee will be required for a disposal well b an annual inspection fee is levied upon each well within an enhanced recovery project operated or maintained under a permit issued from the city such fee shall be in an amount as described in the city fee schedule payable to the city 30 days before the annual anniversary date of the issuance of any permit under this article c an annual inspection fee is levied upon each disposal well operated and maintained under a permit issued from the city such fee shall be in an amount as described in the city fee schedule payable to the city on or before the annual anniversary date of the issuance of any permit under this article d no permit for any well shall be considered valid for any year for which the annual fee has not been paid e upon the completion of the enhanced recovery project or disposal well application required and accompanied by the appropriate required fee the city manager and staff shall have at least 30 business days to review the application and make a recommendation of approval or disapproval to the city commission    operation and equipment requirements a every enhanced recovery or disposal well shall be so constructed as to seal the injection zone from the upper portion of the casing the annulus between the injection tubing and the casing shall be filled with a noncorrosive fluid then sealed and a onefourthinch female fitting with cutoff valve shall be attached so that the pressure in the annulus may be measured by the oil and gas inspector by attaching a gauge having a onefourthinch male fitting the annulus between the production casing and the injection tubing shall be pressure tested to a pressure of at least 250 pounds per square inch greater than the injection pressure proposed for the well the pressure testing shall be witnessed and state approved by the oil and gas inspector copies of the corporation commission form no 1015 shall also be filed with the oil and gas inspector pressure shall be maintained in the annulus sufficient to monitor the fluids in the annulus any significant deviation from the established pressure shall be cause to shut down the well and may result in cancellation of the operating permit until such time as the established pressure can once again be maintained b injection lines for such wells shall be buried in a trench not less than four feet and shall be pressuretested static annually at a minimum of 150 percent of the pressure normally encountered at the injection pump discharge for a period of hours to be fixed by the oil and gas inspector the oil and gas inspector shall be notified in writing five days in advance of such test and may supervise the test test results shall be filed with the city upon completion c the annulus between the production casing and the surface casing shall be equipped with the appropriate fittings to provide a onefourthinch female fitting equipped with a cutoff valve so that the pressure in the annulus may be measured by the oil and gas inspector any indication of pressure which deviates proportionately to the injection pressure to the tubing injection pressure on this annulus shall be cause to shut down the well and may result in the cancellation of the operating permit until such time as the problem can be corrected d the permit for an enhanced recovery or disposal well shall state the maximum injection pressure exceeding this injection pressure shall be considered a violation of this chapter e the injection tubing or injection line near the injection tubing shall be equipped with a onefourthinch female fitting and cutoff valve so that the oil and gas inspector may measure the injection pressure by the installation of a gauge equipped with a standard onefourthinch male fitting f before performing any downhole work on an enhanced recovery or disposal well the operator shall notify the oil and gas inspector at least five days in advance of performing this work the oil and gas inspector shall witness the installation of tubing and packer in an enhanced recovery or disposal well the annulus between the injection tubing and the production casing shall then be pressure tested to a pressure at least 250 pounds per square inch in excess of the approved injection pressure the oil and gas inspector shall witness the pressure testing of this annulus the pressure test shall be repeated at least once a year and shall be witnessed by the oil and gas inspector g the permittee or operator of the well shall submit to the oil and gas inspector a monthly report stating the amount of water injected during the month and the maximum tubing pressure if requested a copy of corporation commission forms 1012 and 1072 shall be submitted yearly to the oil and gas inspector h the location of all injection lines for enhanced recovery or deleterious substance disposal wells shall be recorded by the oklahoma one call system or otherwise brought into compliance with the oklahoma underground facilities damage prevention act 63 os  142 et seq    additional bond and insurance coverage in addition to drilling bond requirements as stated in section 2869 the operator of an enhanced recovery project shall provide the following within the project application process 1 a statement stating that permittee shall indemnify and hold the city harmless from any and all liability attributable to granting the permit 2 the permittee shall carry a policy of standard comprehensive public liability insurance and such policy shall a contain coverage for contamination or pollution of surface or subterranean streams watercourses lakes or public or private water supplies b be conditioned for payment of all damages due to injury to persons or damage to property resulting from the drilling operation or maintenance of the proposed well or any structure machinery equipment pipelines or appurtenances used in connection therewith c name the permittee and the city as coinsured d be issued by an insurance company authorized to do business within the state and the policy shall be in the aggregate providing for a minimum coverage in an amount as described in the city fee schedule combined single limit 3 the permittee shall file with the city clerk certificates of such insurance and bond the insurance policy and bond shall not be cancelled without actual written notice received by the city clerk at least 30 days prior to the effective date of cancellation if the insurance policy is cancelled the permit granted shall terminate immediately and the permittees rights to operate under the permit shall cease immediately until the permittee files additional insurance as provided in this section further if the insurance policy is cancelled or allowed to expire the city manager shall notify the electric company of the violation and service to all wells not conforming shall be discontinued immediately for other wells not electric an injunction will be filed immediately    drilling testing and maintenance of freshwater monitoring wells a prior to the commencement of any enhanced recovery project or disposal well program the permittee and the operator thereof shall be required to drill monitoring wells located in any and all freshwater zones within the enhanced recovery unit or disposal area b the number of monitoring wells will be determined by the city manager and oil and gas inspector the criteria for determining the number of monitoring wells will be based upon the number of surface acres number of injection wells surface deterrents to the location of monitoring wells and other factors based upon the best judgment of the city manager and oil and gas inspector c every six months from and after the issuance of the permit for the enhanced recovery or disposal well the permittee and the operator thereof shall cause water samples to be obtained from the test water well by a registered hydrologist the hydrologist shall then subject the water sample to an analysis to determine all of the following chloride content ph conductivity total dissolved solids sulfates the direction of freshwater flow and barium content a certified report containing the results of such analysis shall then be forthwith filed with the oil and gas inspector d the testing and analysis required by subsection c of this section shall be the responsibility of the permittee and operator and at their expense and shall be conducted by a registered professional hydrologist approved by the oil and gas inspector the oil and gas inspector shall be notified in writing ten days in advance of such testing and may be present for the testing e the oil and gas inspector is empowered to require further water testing procedures to be conducted andor require additional wells to be drilled as are necessary in his judgment to safeguard all waters of the city from pollution f if reports from monitoring wells are unsatisfactory the oil and gas inspector with approval of the city manager is empowered to require immediate remedies to be enacted including the cessation of all operational activities    domestic and public water wells a domestic and public water supply wells located within a radius of onequarter mile of any enhanced recovery or disposal well shall be tested prior to beginning injection and disposal and annually thereafter for the presence of deleterious substances such as chlorides sulfates and dissolved solids such testing is the responsibility of the permittee and at the permittees expense is to be conducted by a registered hydrologist approved by the oil and gas inspector the oil and gas inspector shall be notified five days in advance of such testing and may be present test results shall be filed with the oil and gas inspector upon completion if the permittee is unable to comply with the required tests the permittee shall submit a written statement specifying the reasons for noncompliance b the permittee is liable for damages to any domestic or public water supply wells located within the permitted enhanced recovery unit c failure to comply with mandatory testing and without cityapproved reasons for noncompliance by the permittee is grounds for fines to be levied determination of the fine will be made by the city manager and the oil and gas inspector    standards for fittings and other related material under this article all fittings tubing and pipeline materials which come into direct contact with saltwater or other deleterious fluids shall be designed and manufactured from corrosiveresistant material pipe and fittings must be designed with sufficient wall thickness or must be designed with adequate protection to withstand anticipated external and internal pressure loads that will be imposed on the pipe and fittings after installation and must meet a minimum in design factor of 15    special requirement for injection pipelines the placing of injection pipelines pursuant to this article shall be done under provisions located within this chapter with the following additional requirements 1 nonmetallic materials shall be buried with a metallic tracing material 2 there shall be installed adequate monitoring devices and safety controls which will shut off or isolate systems deviating from normal operating pressure and rates 3 if soft material rocks or other unsuitable material of poor bearing qualities are found at the bottom of pipe trenchesexcavations stabilization shall be achieved by over excavating and backfilling to grade with an approved compacted bedding such as sand fine gravel crushed stone or a concrete foundation with a sand bedding 4 pipes shall be sleeved and otherwise protected from damage should tunneling or street boring be necessary 5 pipes shall be sleeved and adequately supported where conditions are such that the piping must be elevated due to obstacles such as rivers or other similar conditions 6 backfill around pipes shall be free of rocks frozen chunks broken concrete and other rubble which may damage or misalign the pipe during the backfill and tamping operation 7 all buried pipe shall be provided with a warning tape installed at an approximate depth of 12 inches below the surface of the ground above the pipe 8 pipeline warning posts shall be arranged and designed to clearly identify the buried pipeline and provide an emergency phone number should a break occur    drilling completion and maintenance of water source wells a a drilling application must be submitted for an enhanced recovery water source well the application will be the same format and the applicable fee will be the same as any well application drilling permit b the entire well bore will be cemented c a bond log will be submitted to the oil and gas inspector d if any leakage or spillage of any pollution or deleterious substance occurs whatever the cause thereof the permittee shall cause the city manager or the oil and gas inspector to be notified promptly if in the judgment of the city manager such leakage or spillage represents a potential environmental hazard he may issue whatever corrective orders he deems appropriate and additionally may require the appropriate testing of the surface and subsurface for pollutant incursion the cost of such test to be borne by the permittee    stationary equipment noise abatement a stationary equipment or other appurtenances used in relation with an enhanced recovery project or disposal well shall be maintained at a low noise level the following are rules and requirements for such a procedure 1 the following table shall be used to determine the acceptable noise level for all sites table 1 for limiting sound levels for land use sites zoning district classification time averaged minimummaximum sound level limits dba residential  am pm 5565  pm am 5060 commercial business  am pm 6070  pm am 5560 industrial agriculture 24 hours a day 7080 2 the permittee of an enhanced recovery project or disposal well is obligated to install devices buildings or other procedures to maintain an acceptable noise level b authorization for the city to ascertain acceptable noise levels is indicated in sections 20170a1 and 201714 c the oil and gas inspector is authorized to use acceptable scientific measuring devices to determine the noise levels at any operational location this shall be done on an irregular schedule d if the noise level is above acceptable levels at any operational site the oil and gas inspector shall inform the permittee to immediately apply remedial methods to lower the excessive noise e if the excessive noise level is not lowered as determined by the oil and gas inspector the city manager is authorized to assess a penalty of an unspecified amount which may include an operational cessation order    deepening and sidetracking wells from existing well bores under this article deepening an existing well bore or sidetracking a well from an existing well bore shall be permitted upon proper approval from the corporation commission and the city manager or the oil and gas inspector and may require city commission approval    secs 2820428230  reserved article vi  pipelines division 1  generally supervision by city officials the city manager director of public works oil and gas inspector city engineer and the chief of police shall exercise constant supervision of the pipelines flow lines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment located in the streets alleys and public places and report to the city commission all violations of this article and all dangerous defective or unsuitably placed pipelines flow lines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment and guard the public at all times from the dangers incident to the erection maintenance and operation of all pipelines flow lines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment used in connection with the sale or distribution of natural or artificial gas to consumers in the city and its environs and in the gathering of raw hydrocarbons from producing oil and gas wells within the city limits and in the transportation of water or saltwater used in connection with enhanced recovery of oil and gas wells within the city limits in under or upon the streets alleys or public places    limitations upon rights granted the sections of this article or any acts and proceedings conducted under this article shall not be construed as a grant by the city of the right or privilege to use the streets alleys or public places for the purposes provided in this article or any purpose except for and during the annual period immediately succeeding the time fixed for payment of fees to the city and then only if such payment is actually made    interpretation a none of the sections of this article shall be construed or operate to prevent or render unnecessary the securing of any franchise for the erection maintenance or operation of pipelines flow lines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment in under or upon any of the streets alleys or public places if the pipelines and the equipment referred to are used in the sale or distribution of natural or artificial gas to consumers in the city and its environs nor shall any section of this article or any act or proceeding conducted under this article be construed as a grant by the city of the right or privilege to use the streets alleys or public places for the purposes provided b the compensation provided by ordinance for the unfranchised use of the streets alleys and public places shall be in lieu of damages for occupation and use and shall be in addition to other penalties provided for in this article c the city does not waive any of its rights to have the charges provided for in this article upheld as a tax as authorized under the charter d this article or any part of it may be altered or repealed at any time and no rights or privileges shall ever be acquired under it which may not be withdrawn altered or modified by the city    violations each days violation of any section of this article shall constitute a separate offense    abatement of nuisances the city engineer oil and gas inspector andor the chief of police shall summarily abate or remove any of the pipelines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment declared by this article to be a nuisance immediately upon the order given by the city commission no person shall prevent or attempt to prevent any city officer or employee or agent from abating or removing any such pipelines meters valves gauges pumps appliances and equipment declared to be a nuisance or interfere with such officer employee or agent when engaged in or attempting to engage in such work    fee collection procedure the taxes and fees required to be paid by this article shall be deemed a debt to the city and upon failure to pay them the city may maintain a civil action in any court of competent jurisdiction for the recovery and collection of the debt    discontinuance of unsafe pipeline if a pipeline becomes unsafe or is not maintained as provided in this article or if any of the contents escape the person in control of the line shall immediately discontinue its use and shut off all its contents until the line is repaired    special provisions for refined natural gas pipelines a all pipelines connections and fixtures installed or used for the purpose of the transportation of refined natural gas shall be equivalent to the specifications of the national gas safety approved by the united states department of commerce and now in force as to thickness weight size strength and general character of material workmanship and manner of installation b the location of pipelines used to transport refined natural gas to consumers will be located in the utility reserve associated with the granting of the franchise permitted by ordinance extensions of such lines may be installed in private rightsofway after being granted permission by the individual surface owners all plats relating to the installation of consumer lines shall be made available to the office of city engineer    special provisions for hydrocarbon flow lines and gathering systems the granting of an application for drilling within the city limits implies the applicant has the right to retrieve and transport oil gas and water from the oil or gas well certain restrictions related to health and safety shall be placed upon the method of transportation of these products they are as follows 1 a gathering system with lines larger than 2 78 inches outside diameter pipe shall be laid in the least restrictive rightsofway such should be within a sparse population area with no major restoration processes necessary these areas may be within private or public property designations such an area may be designated as a pipeline corridor 2 individual flow lines to specific wells located from the pipeline corridor may be permitted for lines of 2 78 inches or less to be placed within a utility rightofway or private property for not more than threequarters of a mile this type of line may carry oil gas or water or a combination thereof permission for use of a private rightofway must first be obtained prior to an application being presented to the city for approval private surface permission should be based upon proper compensation surface restoration and particular individual restrictions the formal application for a specific flow line shall be submitted to the city engineer for inspection prior the issuance of street boring permits the cost of permits is defined by ordinance and all restrictions applicable to the laying of lines are listed in other ordinances and compliance will be monitored 3 an applicant for the permit required by this article shall file a plan with the city engineer showing in detail the size of the pipeline and the depth and width and the exact location of the excavation or pipeline with particular reference to all structures or lines of the city or any public utility company sidewalk pavement or other public improvement plans for a gathering system shall be submitted to the city engineer for inspection prior to the issuance of street boring permits the cost of permits are defined by ordinance and all restrictions applicable to the laying of lines are listed in other ordinances and compliance will be monitored 4 all street crossings will be bored and cased with proper identifications installed after construction is finished no bore will be attempted without a boring permit granted by fee from the city such fee is established by ordinance 5 all proposed gathering systems and specific flow lines will be granted final approval by the city commission 6 a cathodic protection of pipelines will be installed for all lines 7 line markers and other appurtenances will be installed as needed    pipe specifications for flow lines and gathering systems a pipe specifications for flow lines will conform to the following requirements or better 1 the pipe shall be new no more than 2 78 inches outside diameter coated and wrapped capable of maintaining a minimum 1000 pounds of pressure 2 individual sections of pipe will be joined by either a continuous butt weld or by the electric resistance weld 3 all pipe will be inspected by the appropriate officials before the pipe is welded b pipe specifications for gathering systems lines shall comply with rules and regulations supplied by the state corporation commission and the state department of transportation and other regulations as specifically supplied by the city engineer and other city officials all metal pipe shall be coated and wrapped all pipe will be inspected by city officials prior to installation metal pipe sections will be joined by either a continuous butt weld or by the electric resistance weld    pressure limitations under this article pressure in any line shall not exceed those permitted by the rules regulations or orders of the corporation commission in force all lines shall be operated and maintained in a safe manner at all times so as to prevent all leakage or escape of their contents    ditches a all ditches for pipelines shall be excavated in a manner that will have the smallest possible opening in the public and private property specifically flow lines of 2 78 inches or less shall be placed in a ditch not less than four inches or not wider than six inches gathering system lines larger than 2 78 inches shall be placed in a ditch at least six inches plus or minus wider than the outside diameter of the pipe so that there is a minimum sixinch plus or minus space between the outside diameter and the ditch wall b the rightofway shall be restored to the original or better condition during restoration operations    pipes under streets on streets and alleys all pipelines shall be buried to a minimum depth of 30 inches below the normal surface of the ground the depth to be measured from the top of the pipe and shall be approved by the city engineer andor street department supervisor    removal or change of pipe if it becomes necessary to change or remove any pipeline the entire expense of change or removal shall be borne by the owner upon the approval of the city engineer andor street department supervisor  removal or change shall be made within five days after notice is given by the city    testing of transmission gathering system and flow lines  correction of defects each owner or operator of a transmission gathering system and flow lines shall have it tested at least once every six months for the purpose of determining whether it is in safe condition and free from leaks breaks or open spaces and shall make a report of the test supported by an affidavit by the person making the test to the oil and gas inspector the test may be by the stench method electrical detection method or any other method other than a pressure method approved by the oil and gas inspector provided that each line at the time of its installation shall be tested by the oil and gas inspector and a report of the test shall be filed with the city engineer before the operation of that line testing periods shall end on september 15 and march 15 of each year no person shall continue the operation of any pipeline after the termination of any testing period provided in this section without having it tested and making the required report for failure to make the test and report or if the report discloses or it otherwise appears that any line is leaking defective or unsafe the oil and gas inspector shall within five days of such disclosure or within five days after the closing of any testing period close and shut the pipeline    fees for interchanging of pipelines if a pipeline covered by this article is placed in a ditch where another similarly covered pipeline is being removed and if it is not necessary to deepen the ditch and a highpressure line is not exchanged where a lowpressure line has previously been a fee in the amount established by ordinance shall be collected however when it is necessary to deepen the ditch and the new pipeline being placed in the ditch is a highpressure line taking the place of a lowpressure line an additional fee in the amount established by ordinance shall be charged for the removal of the old line    alternative to removal of pipelines under paving in lieu of the actual removal of a pipeline or portion thereof located underneath any paved street or alley the owner of a pipeline for which a removal permit has been applied for and issued may relinquish his ownership and abandon that portion beneath any paving by first pumping the pipe full of mud and securely plugging each end of the pipe left beneath the paving before abandoning and plugging the pipe the owner shall file with the city clerk or shall incorporate in the application for the removal permit a written transfer and assignment to the city of all his interest possession and title in and to the abandoned pipe and shall give 48 hours previous written notice to the city engineer andor street department supervisor as to when and where the owner proposes to plug the pipe the work shall be subject to inspection and approval of the city engineer andor street department supervisor or authorized representative    secs 2824828275  reserved division 2  excavation permit required no person shall make an excavation in any part of the public property or in any public utility reserve for the purpose of laying removing installing or maintaining a pipeline without first having obtained a permit from the city commission    consent of
